column3: Discovering a crashed airplane_ its dead pilot_ and four million dollars in unsought cash_ Hank Mitchell believes all he will have to do is wait_ until his manipulative pregnant wife compels him to commit blackmail_ deceit_ and murder.

The villainous Ungatt Trunn_ a menacing wildcat_ has brought his powers to bear on Salamandastron_ threatening the peace-loving beasts whho live there.

But all is not lost. Old Lord Stonepaw_ the venerable Badger Ruler_ summons the strongest of the strong to take over as lord of the badgermountain and battle the evil wildcat.

Together with his companion_ the young hairemaid Dotti_ Lord Brocktree travels towards Salamandastron. But can he raise an army in time to smash Ungatt Trunn's terrifying Blue Hordes?

A man hires a company to cut the grass of his overgrown  yard_ yet the man who appears has an unusual method to his work.
First published in Cavalier_ May 1975

A killer stalks a small community college campus when the weather becomes infused with the thick fogs of a "strawberry spring."
First published in Cavalier_ November 1975.

column3:
A man from New Jersey stumbles out of a massive snowstorm and into a small pub. Stricken with frostbite and fatigue_ he pleads for help to fetch his wife and daughter who are stranded in their car in the raging storm back near Jerusalem's Lot.
First published in Maine Magazine_ March/April_ 1977.

A former tennis pro is forced to play a deadly game for having seduced the wife of a wealthy man.
First published in Penthouse.

First published in Gallery_ August 1977.

Quitters_ Inc. will do anything to help you stop smoking.

Years ago_ Larry saved his sister's life. Now she is going to do something terrible.
First published in the collection Night Shift_ NY: Doubleday_ February 1978.

column3:
A woman who cannot die suffers from cancer. Only her son can bring relief.
Originally published in the collection Night Shift_ 1978.

column2: Fiction_Crime and Mystery_Barbara  Paul_Gary A.  Braunbeck
column3:
Have you ever been robbed_ directly or by some high-tech snafu or manipulation?  Are you positive you could plan the perfect crime (even though you'd never carry it out)?  Or do you think that given all the clues you could solve any crime_ outsmart any criminal?  Well_ here's your chance to match your wits with the pros who took up the challenge of creating and solving crimes that have not yet occurred.  They run the gamut from low-tech to high_ from activities against entire societies to one-on-one_ completely personal crimes.  Let sixteen master sleuths take you along on their crime beats future style with such cases as:
* He could tell the suitcase was valuable the minute he saw the foreigners fighting over it_ but could a hill country native outsmart men equipped with the latest ways to deal death?
* The play's the thing...and even holographic actors should be able to help him convict the people he was certain had caused his father's death...
* When his computer system began to malfunction_ what choice did he have but to let the building repairman in- but was he letting in a rescuer or a destroyer?

An anthology of 16 all-new stories edited by Martin H. Greenberg and John Helfers for DAW Books_ 1999. Contents_ in alphabetical order of contributors:

Pia and the King of Siam by Janet Berliner
Glory Hand in the Soft City by Jay Bonansinga
All the Unlived Moments by Gary Braunbeck
The White City by Alan Brennert
Setting Free the Daughters of Earth by Peter Crowther
The Death of Winston Foster by R. Davis
Pein Bek Longpela Telimpon by Alan Dean Foster
Good Repair by Craig Shaw Gardner
Tinker's Last Case by Ron Goulart
The Crime of Transfiguration by Will Murray
The Mojave Two-Step by Norman Partridge
Shakespeare Minus One by Barbara Paul
The Serpent Was More Subtle by Tom Piccirilli
The Kidnapping of Roni Tahr by Alan Rodgers
In Memoriam by Mike Stotter
Sleep That Burns by Jerry Sykes

column3: The Sign of the Four_ the second Holmes novel_ presents the detective with one of his greatest challenges. The theft of the Agra treasure in India forms a catalyst for treachery_ deceit and murder.

column3:
A young man's lament for his departed lover_ Annabel Lee.
First published as part of Poe's obituary in New York Daily Tribune_ 9 October 1849 (followed by several nationwide obituary reprints throughout October and November);Published in Southern Literary Messenger November 1849;First authorized publication in Sartain's Union Magazine_ January 1850.

column3: While reading an ancient mystic text_ a man is interrupted by a knocking on his study door and discovers_ in an eerie_ horror-filled sequence_ that his visitor is a raven.

A bittersweet memoir of the journeys of one of our distant ancestors long after the Blast. Rush That Speaks wanders his way through post-apocalyptic America_ meets a wise man in a tree and an Avvenger_ joins Dr. Boots' List_ and finds a place among the dwellers in the sky.

column2: Fiction_Crime and Mystery_Barbara  Paul_John  Lutz_Barbara  D'Amato_Nancy  Pickard_Carole Nelson  Douglas_Jennifer  Waddell
column3:
Nancy Pickard reveals a centuries-old secret passed on to Bess Truman that threatens the very foundation of the White House... Anne Perry turns the White House red when Edith Wilson finds a blackmailer dead on the floor... Judith Kelman unveils a First Lady-to-be who has deadly bad hair days... Pamela Fesler loses herself in inauguration mischief with Lou Henry Hoover...P .M. Carlson unwraps a kidnapping plot surrounding Mrs. Grover Cleveland's beloved daughter_ Baby Ruth... Gillian Roberts serves up a deliciously sweet tale of deception and intrigue at Dolley Madison's White House... Sarah Shankman replays the Watergate scandal and erases all memory of Nixon's good Republican wife... and a host of other writers deceive_ thrill_ and entertain us with these fascinating First Ladies who know that life at the White House can be murder. 

Complete list of stories: (All stories copyright 1999)

The Secret President by Barbara Paul
Political Decision by John Lutz
'A' Is for Adams by Carolyn Wheat
You Run by Sarah Shankman
The Bachelor's Wife by Judith Kelman
Lost at Sea by Pamela J. Fesler
Madame President by Anne Perry
The Mother of Our Country by Linda V. Williams
Dolley Madison and the Staff of Life by Barbara D'Amato
Alice Holds the Cards by Jennifer Waddell
Jackie-O by Kristine Kathryn Rusch
Goodbye_ Dolley by Gillian Roberts
Portal by T. J. MacGregor
Adams and Evil by Sarah Booth Conroy
A Tale of Two Sisters by Richard Timothy Conroy
The Second Lady by Peter Crowther
The First Ladies' Secret by Nancy Pickard
Mrs. Lincoln's Dilemma by Janet Dawson
Julia Grant_ a.k.a. Private Eye" by Jan Grape
Blood in Buzzard's Bay; or_ Sweets to the Sweet by P. M. Carlson

column1: A New York State of Crime
column3:
Edited by: Feroze Mohammed

Three tales of murder most Manhattan.

Printed in the September/October issue of Ellery Queen's Mystery Magazine.

The title character is a woman just released from prison who is blackmailed into working for the owner of a large_ upscale detective agency. Callie Darrow has been a thief and a con artist all her life_ but her stint in prison convinced her to look for a better way to live. But her resolution is thwarted by the man blackmailing her_ who is forcing her back into that same environment that made her what she is. 

I've always wanted to write a waterfront story_ and this is it. It's Callie's contacts among the grifters and the thieves and the middlemen and the smugglers that make her so valuable to the detective agency; she can move through the back streets of the waterfront the way no outsider can. So Callie is walking a tightrope; if she fails to come through for the agency_ she goes back to prison. And if her old cohorts ever learn she's now on the side of the law_ she's dead.

iblist.com user synopsisIn the sixties people said and did weird things.  This is a story about two of them.
Jonathan has a secret that no one knows about... He can leave his body and fly... Now he plots his revenge on all the people who torment him.

iblist.com user synopsisAn obsessed fan abducts twenty-year-old actress Bliss Marshall and brings her to his isolated island home in Maine. His objective is to save her from "Hollywood life" and bring her back to her roots. He films her constantly to capture the transformation from Hollywood starlet to whole woman_ and intends to release the footage as a movie in which they star together_ bringing him the fame he craves.

When Dr. Martin Farrow discovered a mutant rabies virus_ the government forced him to develop more vicious strains in isolated Blue Harbor_ Maine. Then two animal-rights activists broke into his lab and liberated the virus--turning the entire town of Blue Harbor into a city of crazed beasts.
A mostly-coherent story of Fred_ and how he helped to orchestrate the downfall of a corporation that took over the country.

They were back in the audio-visual room again and Ted said_ "Joy_ we're crazy to do things here in school!"

Her eyes were shining. "But isn't it great when you almost get caught?" she said. "Don't you feel so alive?"

Ted Wharton_ 42_ a teacher at Whitman High in Somerside_ New Jersey_ lives a routine suburban life with his wife and kids. After fifteen years at the school he is disenchanted with teaching; he's just going through the motions at work- and also at home. Nothing excites him anymore_ he fears that nothing ever will_ and the clock is ticking.

Then it happens: on the same day that one of Ted's colleagues drops dead of a heart attack_ Joy Dollinger_ 17_ a bright_ irreverent_ stunningly beautiful senior in one of his classes_ makes a play for him. He puts up no resistance_ and lets Joy take him on a long soul-shattering trip that shakes his spirit from its sleep. Exhilarated_ fully alive for the first time in years_ he revels in his wild trysts with Joy- many of which take place at Whitman High.

Day after day_ Ted lives on the edge_ obsessed with Joy- and terrified that his life will unravel. If his wife finds out what's going on_ what then? If his colleagues find out? If Joy's father_ who's trying to purge the Somerside schools of "obscene" books finds out? Or what if Joy_ as she hints she might_ tells all to her parents unless Ted vows to marry her? Panicked_ he tries to end their relationship-and things spiral out of control.

A tragicomical tale of desire_ deceit and betrayal_ Fever 42 is a thunderbolt of a novel_ an unforgettable Joyride.

At once low-key and bizarre_ these stories mingle satire and sympathy; their dialogue is not always what it seems on the printed page; their setting are simultaneously fantastic and all too actual. Their shock goes beyond recognition to linger in the consciousness of their readers.

column1: One Day in the Short Happy Life of Anna Banana: And Other Maine Stories
column3:

"I want to do things..."

Take one bored princess. Make her the seventh daughter in a very proper royal family. Have her run away.

Add one powerful_ fascinating_ dangerous dragon.

Princess Cimorene has never met anyone (or anything) like the dragon Kazul. But then_ she's never met a witch_ a jinn_ a death-dealing talking bird_ or a stone prince either.

Princess Cimorene ran away to find some excitement.

She's found plenty.

"Can you send us straight to the Enchanted Forest? We're kind of in a hurry..."

The cast: an un-ordinary king and an extraordinary princess_ a couple of kooky giants_ an overzealous magician_ a loyl and helpful witch_ and a host of evil and dangerous wizards.

The instruments: a broken-down magic carpet_ a leaking magical sword_ and a few buckets of soapy lemon water.

The problem: dragon-napping and magic-stealing.

And so the story begins_ one fine day while King Mendanbar is taking a casual stroll through the Enchanted Forest...

"We need to see King Mendanbar and Queen Cimorene right away..."

They're back! Except Princess Cimorene is now Queen Cimorene of the Enchanted Forest_ and she is on a very important mission with Kazul the dragon king_ Morwen the witch_ Telemain the magician_ two cats_ and a blue_ flying donkey-rabit named Killer. It's not going to be easy.

The wizards have become very smart (sort of) and have found a way to capture the most powerful source of magic in the Enchanted Forest -- King Mendanbar's sword. If the sword is not returned to the forest in due time_ the forest will begin to die. And you can bet your last dragon scale that Cimorene won't stand for that!

"Mother taught me to be polite to dragons..."

Daystar never thought he'd be walking through the Enchanted Forest with a magic sword_ a fire-witch_ and a baby dragon. He never dreamed his mother_ Cimorene_ would tell him to leave their home and not to return until his task was complete. Or that he alone held the power to release King Mendanbar and the Enchanted Forest from the wizards' evil spell. He doesn't even know who King Mendanbar is.

But Daystar learns quickly -- and that's good_ because he's about to encounter magic and wizards and dragons. Quite a deadly combination.

Her family has been destroyed. It is her task to restore their honor.

Like other noble girls in the Japanese imperial court_ Mitsuko lives behind screens of modesty_ hiding her face behind her kimono sleeves. But when her village is attacked_ her brother-in-law murdered_ and her family taken away by a warlord_ Mitsuko finds the courage to venture into the netherworld. With the help of Goranu_ a shape-shifter_ she fights for her family -- even if it means her own death.
